title: AP Physics 1 - Kinematics Fundamentals
description: Comprehensive kinematics quiz covering motion, velocity, acceleration, and free fall concepts for AP Physics 1.

questions.question: An object moves along a straight line with constant acceleration. Which of the following graphs represents velocity versus time for this motion?
options: A straight line with positive slope
A straight line with negative slope
questions.explanation: For constant acceleration, velocity changes linearly with time, resulting in a straight line on a velocity-time graph. The slope represents acceleration.

questions.question: A ball is thrown vertically upward with an initial velocity of 20 m/s. Neglecting air resistance, what is its velocity when it returns to its original height?
questions.explanation: Due to symmetry in projectile motion, the ball returns with the same speed but opposite direction. The motion is symmetric about the peak.

questions.question: Which of the following is true for an object in free fall near Earth's surface?
options: Velocity increases by 9.8 m/s each second
Velocity decreases by 9.8 m/s each second
Acceleration is zero at the peak
questions.explanation: In free fall, acceleration is constant at 9.8 m/s² downward. This means velocity changes by 9.8 m/s each second.

questions.question: A car accelerates uniformly from rest to 30 m/s in 6 seconds. What is its acceleration?
questions.explanation: Using a = Δv/Δt = (30 m/s - 0 m/s) / 6 s = 5 m/s²

questions.question: The area under a velocity-time graph represents:
questions.explanation: The integral of velocity with respect to time gives displacement. Area under v-t graph = displacement.

questions.question: A projectile is launched at 45° above horizontal. At the highest point of its trajectory, which is true?
questions.explanation: At the peak, vertical velocity is zero but horizontal velocity remains constant. Acceleration is always 9.8 m/s² downward.

questions.question: An object moves with constant velocity. Which statement must be true?
questions.explanation: Constant velocity means both constant speed and constant direction, therefore acceleration must be zero.

questions.question: A ball is dropped from a height of 80 meters. How long does it take to hit the ground? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: Using y = ½gt² → 80 = ½(10)t² → t² = 16 → t = 4 seconds

questions.question: The slope of a position-time graph gives:
questions.explanation: Slope of position-time graph = Δposition/Δt = velocity

questions.question: Two objects are dropped from the same height, but one is given an initial horizontal velocity. Which hits the ground first?
options: Both hit at the same time
questions.explanation: Vertical motion is independent of horizontal motion. Both have the same vertical acceleration and initial vertical velocity.

questions.question: A car's speed changes from 20 m/s to 30 m/s over 4 seconds. What is the average acceleration?
An object moving in a circle at constant speed has:
questions.explanation: Even with constant speed, the changing direction means velocity is changing, hence there is centripetal acceleration.

questions.question: A stone is thrown horizontally from a cliff at 15 m/s. It hits the ground 3 seconds later. How far from the base does it land?
questions.explanation: Horizontal distance = horizontal velocity × time = 15 m/s × 3 s = 45 meters

questions.question: Which quantity has both magnitude and direction?
questions.explanation: Vectors have magnitude and direction (e.g., velocity, acceleration). Scalars have only magnitude (e.g., speed, distance).

questions.question: A car travels 60 meters north, then 80 meters east. What is the magnitude of its displacement?
The acceleration due to gravity on the Moon is about 1/6 of Earth's. If you drop an object on the Moon, its acceleration is:
questions.explanation: g_moon = (1/6) × 9.8 m/s² ≈ 1.63 m/s² downward

questions.question: A ball is thrown straight up. At the highest point, its acceleration is:
questions.explanation: Gravity always acts downward at 9.8 m/s², even when velocity is zero at the peak.

questions.question: If the velocity of an object is constant, then the acceleration is:
questions.explanation: Constant velocity means no change in velocity, therefore acceleration is zero.

questions.question: A car accelerates from 10 m/s to 30 m/s over a distance of 80 meters. What is its acceleration?
Which graph represents an object at rest?
questions.explanation: A horizontal line on a position-time graph indicates constant position, meaning the object is at rest.
